title: Advanced Wellness Plus Insurance Overview
summary: The slide presents the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' insurance plan, highlighting its association with American Financial Security Life Insurance Co. It features an image of a healthcare professional interacting with an elderly patient, suggesting a focus on health and wellness. The insurance is described as a Limited Benefit Health Insurance Plan, underwritten by American Financial Security Life Insurance Co., and is issued to the National Congress of Employers. The policy forms mentioned include AF FI Policy 721 and AFS LM 721 AWP BR.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus Benefit Overview
summary: The slide presents a detailed benefits table for the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' plan, outlining various medical benefits and their corresponding coverage limits across different plan levels (100A, 100, 200, 200+, 300, 500, 750, 1000). Benefits include Hospital Confinement, Primary and Specialty Care Doctors Office Visits, Emergency Room, Basic Pathology & Radiology, Advance Studies, Surgery, Anesthesia, Mental Health (Inpatient and Outpatient), Supplemental Accident (Inpatient Admission and Emergency Room), Hospital Intensive Care Unit, Additional Hospital Admission, Accidental Death, and Critical Illness. Coverage amounts vary by plan level, with higher levels offering increased benefits. Notably, there is a 30-day waiting period for coverage, excluding injuries, and a 12-month exclusion for pre-existing conditions.

title: Overview of Advanced Wellness Plus and NCE Membership
summary: The slide provides an overview of the Advanced Wellness Plus program, highlighting the role of the National Congress of Employers (NCE) in offering benefits to small and medium-sized businesses. It explains the membership process, including the receipt of a Purchase Confirmation email and the delivery of a membership packet and ID cards within 7-10 business days. The monthly membership involves a billing statement reflecting the premium for health benefits, with an initial non-refundable enrollment fee. Limited Medical Coverage is described as a plan that supplements major medical plans, offering basic insurance coverage with capped benefits. Eligibility is for adult members aged 18-65 and dependent children aged 1-25.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus - GapAfford Plus Membership Benefits
summary: The slide outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, which offers savings on medical expenses without deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, or age restrictions. It includes a prescription discount program with savings on brand-name and generic medications, and access to the Aetna Dental Access Network for dental care discounts. The OUTLOOK Vision Network provides savings on eyeglasses and contact lenses. Pet Rx offers discounts on pet medications. Alternative medicine, chiropractic care, and hearing savings programs are available, along with imaging savings and medical bill negotiations. Members can save on medical supplies, laboratory services, physical therapy, vitamins, and supplements. The program also includes a 24/7 health information line and nurse help line. Notably, the benefits are not insurance and are not available in certain states.

title: Hospital Indemnity Insurance Limitations & Exclusions
summary: The slide outlines the limitations and exclusions of a hospital indemnity insurance policy. It specifies that benefits will not be provided for treatments, services, or supplies that are not medically necessary, not prescribed by a doctor, experimental, or provided by an immediate family member. Additional exclusions include dental procedures unless related to accidental injury, elective and cosmetic surgeries, felonies or illegal occupations, manipulations of the musculoskeletal system, self-inflicted injuries, war or service-related injuries, work-related injuries, and pre-existing conditions within 12 months of coverage. There is a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits, and no coverage for voluntary abortion unless life-threatening. Coverage provisions may vary by state. Claims can be mailed or electronically submitted to the specified addresses.
